Reading Comprehension Review



Is Gaming Good for You?
Researchers who study online gaming have shown that it is more than just a form of entertainment. In fact, people may benefit from online gaming in a number of ways. For example, multiplayer online gaming can improve social skills because players have to work together toward the same goals. In one study, researchers in the Netherlands surveyed teens who played World of Warcraft. They found that the more frequently most teens played, the more socially successful and less lonely they felt.
Online gaming may also improve thinking skills. In a recent study in Berlin, adults played a video game every day for two months.  Afterwards, researchers scanned the players’ brains. They noticed that the players had more neurons in the parts of the brain that are responsible for memory and planning.
Game designer Jane McGonigal has her own ideas about the benefits of gaming—not just for individual people, but for the whole world. She calls people who play online games for at least one hour a day “virtuoso” gamers. Currently, there are about 500 million virtuoso gamers in the world. McGonigal predicts that in ten years there will be 1.5 billion.
McGonigal believes that these gamers have four characteristics—“superpowers”—that make them better problem solvers. These characteristics are:
• Urgent optimism: Online gamers don’t wait to defeat a dragon. Instead, gamers face any problem immediately—and believe that they can succeed.
• Community builders: Players in an online game have the same goal—to win. They expect that everyone will play fairly and follow the same rules. This helps players build trust and improve cooperation.
• Blissful productivity: Gamers enjoy working hard to achieve online gaming goals. They feel a real sense of accomplishment when they do achieve these goals—the “epic win” feeling.
• Epic meaning: Gamers like being involved in an important mission. The larger-than-life worlds of online gaming make players feel that they are playing a part in a significant story.
Non-gamers may think online gaming is a waste of time and money. Some have argued online games contribute to problems like childhood obesity. However, McGonigal thinks online gamers could be an important global resource if we can design games that help them create “epic wins” in response to real-world problems.

options: to list the benefits of playing online games
to compare different kinds of online games
to tell a story about an online game designer

items.q: In paragraph 2, what was the result of adults playing video games every day for two months?
options: There was more activity in the memory and planning section of their brains.

items.q: What is McGonigal’s definition of “virtuoso” gamers?
options: people who take part in online gaming competitions

items.q: Which phrase describes the feeling when you do really well in a game even though it was very difficult?
options: “virtuoso”

items.q: What is the best definition of “Urgent Optimism”?
options: understanding that you need to fail many times before you succeed
carefully planning how you will successfully overcome a problem

items.q: What is the main idea of this passage?
options: Gamers and non-gamers have been debating the usefulness of online gaming for a long time.

sections.passage:
Reading Comprehension Extension


Alternate Reality Gaming
Jane McGonical is a computer game designer—but her games are different. She makes “alternate reality games,” which aim to harness the unique skills of gamers to solve problems in the real world.
Superbetter (2012)
McGonigal was inspired to create her game Superbetter when she was recovering from a serious concussion injury. The game aims to encourage players to remain optimistic, even when facing the toughest challenges that life can throw at us. According to McGonigal, more than half a million players have played the game, and many found that it could help them overcome illnesses and other problems in their lives. A trial by The University of Pennsylvania supports her claim. Following a controlled trial of Superbetter, it was found that the game could help eliminate symptoms of depression in just six weeks of play.
Breakthrough to Cures (2009)
Breakthrough to Cures was designed to change the way we think about medical research. Players are thrust into a future where disease is threatening the lives of 100 million people in the U.S.A. Then, over a period of 24 hours, gamers are asked to work together to brainstorm solutions to the problem. Players can level-up and gain rewards for contributing useful ideas. As a result of the wide variety of creative ideas generated by the game, Breakthrough to Cures was named as one of the 10 most socially impactful games of 2010 by the organization Games for Change.
The success of Breakthrough to Cures has led to the development of other games for solving future problems. For example, Smart Grid 2025 has been designed to help tackle the energy problems that the world may face in years to come.

items.q: Which gives the best definition of an “alternate reality” game?
options: a computer game that has realistic graphics
a computer game that tries to tackle problems in real life
a computer game that puts gamers into a fantasy world

items.q: What motivated McGonigal to make the game Superbetter ?
options: the experiences of children she met in hospital
a report by the University of Pennsylvania
her own experience of recovering from an injury

items.q: What is the purpose of the game Superbetter ?
options: to give people confidence and motivation to overcome problems in their lives
to provide hospitals with a free game that their patients can play
to give people advice about how they can improve their lives

items.q: Which of these sentences best summarizes the findings of the University of Pennsylvania about Superbetter ?
options: If people play Superbetter , it will make them feel better for six weeks.
If people suffering from depression play Superbetter for six weeks, they will feel better.
Depression has six symptoms that can be eliminated by playing Superbetter .

items.q: According to the article, how many people have played Superbetter ?
options: five hundred thousand
fifty thousand
five thousand

items.q: What was the aim of the game Breakthrough to Cures ?
options: to make people more confident when they are recovering from illness
to help people choose the best medicines for common diseases
to come up with ideas about how a country can deal with a deadly disease

items.q: In the game Breakthrough to Cures , how can players “level-up”?
options: by eliminating a disease
by beating their opponents
by thinking of useful ideas

items.q: Which of the following statements is NOT true about Breakthrough to Cures ?
options: The game generated a wide variety of creative ideas.
According to the organization Games for Change, it was the most socially impactful game of 2010.
The game was set in a future where disease threatened the United States.

items.q: Smart Grid 2025 was developed as a result of . . .
options: an increase in demand for energy in the United States
the success of Breakthrough to Cures
a request from the organization Games for Change

items.q: What is the main aim of Smart Grid 2025 ?
options: to encourage people to use less energy
to make energy available to people in poor countries
to help solve possible future energy problems

sections.passage:
Reading Skills



The Pros and Cons of Computer Games

Computer games have been around now for over 30 years, and the debate about their positive and negative effects upon society is just as old.

While some people argue that (A)gaming promotes an unhealthy, inactive lifestyle, others suggest (B)it may increase our cognitive abilities. Suggestions that (C)gaming turns people into loners with no social skills are countered by those who highlight (D)the highly social online gaming community. Parents who worry that (E)violent games may lead to violent behavior are reminded that violent films have been around for decades. And while some believe that (F)the time and money spent by people playing games would be better used elsewhere, people like Jane McGonigal believe that (G)certain games can help us solve global problems like poverty and climate change.

Whatever your view, it is almost certain that as technology pushes ahead at great speed, computer games are here to stay.

sections.instructions: DIRECTIONS: Read the following excerpt from Jane McGonigal’s 2010 TED Talk and answer the questions.
sections.passage:
Jane McGonigal—Gaming Can Make a Better World

We feel that we are not as good in reality as we are in games. And I don’t mean just good as in successful, although that’s part of it. We do achieve more in game worlds. But I also mean good as in motivated to do something that matters, inspired to collaborate and to cooperate. And when we’re in game worlds I believe that many of us become the best version of ourselves, the most likely to help at a moment’s notice, the most likely to stick with a problem as long at it takes, to get up after failure and try again. And in real life, when we face failure, when we confront obstacles, we often don’t feel that way. We feel overcome, we feel overwhelmed, we feel anxious, maybe depressed, frustrated, or cynical. We never have those feelings when we’re playing games, they just don’t exist in games.

According to McGonigal, what is true both in real life and in the game world? a. We often face problems. b. We often feel anxious.
What does McGonigal say about our feelings? a. We don’t have many strong feelings in the game world. b. We have more negative feelings in the real world.

Which sentence (a–d) is the second sentence of the paragraph?
